metadata.Title: CVE-2021-45485 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the IPv6 implementation in the Linux kernel before 5.13.3,net/ipv6/output_core.c has an information leak because of certain use of ahash table which, although big, doesn't properly consider that IPv6-basedattackers can typically choose among many IPv6 source addresses.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45485` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic-64k - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-lowlatency - 5.13.0-19.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1004-kvm - 5.13.0-1004.4
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required
